IDTService.Description:
This is the BasicStateIDT Service.

The command can be used to restart a test cycle without ending the communication (repair mode).

After the command is answered positive, the bench is ready for testing again (no wheel base required).

This is the ChassisSetupIDT Service.

If the Position can not be approached(system error), answers the state by -1.

This is the ChassisSetupIDT Service.

If the Position can not be approached(system error), answers the state by -1.

This is the ChassisSetupIDT Service.

If the Position can not be approached(system error), answers the state by -1.

This is the EndIDT Service. The command shuts down the cyclical send of data. After sending this service:

  • Connection between test stand and DSA Tester will be closed as soon as acknowledgment of this service is received
  • No Error-Message is generated while IR communication is desconnected
  • Access to the test stand is not possible until Service Start of Testing(Service 1) is excuted again.

This service request is automatically generated from the MFT software at the end of the test.

A new StartIDT service has to be sent to reestablish the communication.
Used to implement the background Error Monitor.

This is the FWE to start WheelCenter Measure (53)
This is the FWE to start WheelHouse Measure (31)
This is the FWE to start WheelHouse Measure (31)

This is the Read Tester Stand Status Result IDT Service.

It will read out the measured and calculated values upon service Request Tester Stand Status

It will read out the measured and calculated values upon service Request Weight Measure Result(Service09).

Server 78 Result total

Used to transfer a Text number to the Test Stand.

Test Stand will

This is the StartIDT Service.

This command must be send initially to open the interface and transfer the MFT's name. If this command is not successfull the interface is not up and cannot be used for testing.

  • The connection between test stand and DSA Tester will be immediately started and cyclically monitored. Interruption leads to Error Messages and Stop of the test stand.
  • The actual readiness for testing is established with service 4(WheelBase).
  • Only after receiving the acknowledgment of this service the MFT is able to execute other services. Access to the test stand is not enabled befor receiving ACK of this Service.

The Service Request will be generated automatically while starting of the test.

This is the StopIDT Service. The command is sent for:

  • Abort of the current Service: test stand should terminate the service if it is still on running
  • Acknowledgement of Service processing: After the test stand has acknowledged a service as completed(with/without errors), the MFT sends service request 0(ServiceStop) and expects acknowledgement 0 from the test stand. A new service request can only be sent after this procedure is completed (even if it is the same request as that before)
  • No Service request. Content of the data is ignored by the test stand!
  • test stand has to update the measurement value.
This is the FWE to start Measure (TestReadiness) (51)
This is the FWE to TransversePositions (28)
This is the FWE to TransversePositions (28)
This is the FWE to start UmschlagsMessung Measure (52)

This is the VehicleIDIDT Service.

The command can be used to transfer the Vehicle ID to the TestStand.

This is the VehicleIDIDT Service.

The command can be used to transfer the Vehicle ID to the TestStand.

Übertragung Ergebnisdaten S-Punkt Im Antwortblock werden die Ergebnisdaten die S-Punkt-Einstellung übertragen.

Fzg. in Prüfbereitschaft bringen: Lenkradwaage einlegen, zentrieren, ... (aber noch keine Messungen durchführen) Quittung erfolgt, wenn Werker am Prüfstand „Messung Start“ (+1=OK) oder „Abbruch“ (-1=NOK) drückt.
Fahrwerkeinstellung Lenkeinschlagsmessung Der auf dem FWE definierte Prüfzyklus wird ausgeführt.
Fahrwerkeinstellung Lenkeinschlagsmessung Der auf dem FWE definierte Prüfzyklus wird ausgeführt.
Service 28 Vehicle transverse positions
Umschlagsmessung Quittung erfolgt, wenn Umschlagsmessung beendet.
Vorbereitung Ausheben VA keine Parameter, keine Rückgabewerte/Messwerte
Start Ausheben VA für S-Punkt-Messung, keine Parameter, Rückgabewerte sind S-Punkt-Werte (Format wie bei Dienst 33)
Start Einstellung VA Spur und S-Punkt keine Parameter, Rückgabewerte sind S-Punkt-Werte (Format wie bei Dienst 33)
Start Einstellung VA Spur und S-Punkt keine Parameter, Rückgabewerte sind S-Punkt-Werte (Format wie bei Dienst 33)
Anforderung Ergebnisdaten Lenkungsprüfung (Nachlauf + Lenkeinschlag) Die Ergebnisdaten der Lenkungsprüfung werden übertragen.
Fahrwerkeinstellung Weitere Parameter siehe separater Abschnitt weiter unten!

Gesamtbewertung und Ergebnisübertragung starten keine Parameter, Ergebnis im Status (-1=NOK, +1=OK) Der Prüfstand fragt den Werker, ob die Prüfung beendet werden soll. Positive Quittung = OK, negative Quittung = NOK (=Wiederholung gewünscht) Achtung: Das Ergebnis liefert den Tastendruck und nicht das Gesamtprüfergebnis ! Bei OK werden ggf. implizit Ergebnisse an ein übergeordnetes System übertragen (NAFS, FISeQS,...)
Ausfördern Start keine Parameter, Quittung erfolgt SOFORT da ggf. ein IR-Kommunikationsgerät den Dienst aus-gelöst haben kann und aus dem IR-Übertragungs-bereich ausgefördert wird.
Übertragung des Winkels der Lenkradwaage Die Übertragung der Lenkradwaagenwerte wird ein- bzw. ausgeschaltet; die Quittierung erfolgt sofort.
Schwimmplattenansteuerung (Im Anschluss muss der Dienst Fzg. positionieren (51) und Umschlagsmessung (52) ausgeführt werden!)
Service Show Text

Togglebyte (used for all Service Request):

  • Used to determine the response time of the MFT.
  • The MFT writes the value, that is read from the previous response block(byte 11), in this request parameter
  • The test stand increments this value in its response block(Byte 11) as soon as Echo of this Toggle byte(service request byte 3) is read from MFT.
Bit 0 0 : Keine Quittierung 1 : Quittierung erforderlich
Bit 0 0 : Radmittelpunktmesswerte abholen ohne 1 : Radmittelpunkt messen und Ergebnisse liefern

Bit.name: Wheel Center Point Measuring and Results

RequestParam.Description: Bit 0 0 : Höhe Radhauskante (VL, VR, HL, HR) messen 1 : Höhe Radhauskante (VL, VR, HL, HR) nicht messen

Bit.name: High Wheel Center (FL, FR, RL, RR)

RequestParam.Description:
Only for Service 22 - (VehicleID)

Type of Vehicle Indentifier:

  • 2: ID (14 Byte): Identification Code is sent in  Bytes 20-33 Bytes 34-36 is blank(0x20)
  • 3: VIN (17 Byte) Bytes 20-36

Chassis Setting:

Bit 0: Rear Axle Setting
Bit 1: Front Axle Setting
Bit 2: Control Measure
Schwimmplattenansteuerung VA (Vorderachse): 0: geklemmt (Schwimmplatten sind fixiert) 1: geführt (Schwimmplatten können gedreht werden) 2: offen (Schwimmplatten sind frei beweglich)
Schwimmplattenansteuerung HA (Hinterachse): 0: geklemmt (Schwimmplatten sind fixiert) 1: geführt (Schwimmplatten können gedreht werden) 2: offen (Schwimmplatten sind frei beweglich)

Chassis Setting:

Bit 0: Rear Axle Setting
Bit 1: Front Axle Setting
Bit 2: Control Measure

Bit 0: Rear Axle Setting
Bit 1: Front Axle Setting
Bit 2: Control Measure
Bit 0 0 : Start der Übertragung 1 : Stop der Übertragung
Bit 0 0 : Start der Übertragung 1 : Stop der Übertragung

Only for Service 51 - (Test Readiness)

  • Bit0: Update height and wheel center values
  • Bit1: Wait 10 seconds after Pruefbereitschaft == 0 ATTENTION OFF is 1

Bit.name: Update height and wheel center values

Only for Service 31 - (WheelHouse)

  • Bit0: 0 : Dynamic Height Measure, 1 : SingleShot Measure
  • Bit1: 0 : Stop dyn Measure, 1 : Start Dyn Measure
  • Bit2: 0 : Do not Measure, just collect results, 1 : Measure Height

  • Bit1: 0 : Stop dyn Measure, 1 : Start Dyn Measure
  • Bit2: 0 : Do not Measure, just collect results, 1 : Measure Height

  • Bit1: 0 : Stop dyn Measure, 1 : Start Dyn Measure
  • Bit2: 0 : Do not Measure, just collect results, 1 : Measure Height

Only for Service 1 - (StartIDT)

The MFT name will be sent to the test stand for documentation. Unused bytes are filled with ,Blank'(0x20).

Only for Service 16 - (ShowText)

Text number to test

  • 0 Clear text
  • 1-255 Number to be displayed on the test screen text

Request continuous MFT Number (used for all Service Request):

  • The continuous MFT number is set by the MFT in the request block (byte 41).
  • The test stand mirrors the number in its answer block(byte 41).
  • As soon as the MFT recognizes that the test stand has mirrored this value is its response, the value is increased by 1 in MFT.

The continuous MFT number works analog to the toggle byte in the other direction.

Checksum XOR (used for all Service Request):

  • The checksum is calculted by the MFT using binary XOR for the request bytes 0-41(inclusive).
  • The test stand checks the received telegram and rejects the entire request, if the checksum is not correct.
  • As the response of a request with incorrect checksum repeats the test stand with the last transmitted service response, whereby response counter is updated(and possibly with updated measurement values​​).

Diagnose-Bytes (used for all Service Request):

  • The diagnostic byte is set to 0 by MFT.
  • All Protocol and hardware layers, that involved in the data transfer, can write their diagnostic information in this parameter.
  • The test stand must not assume the contents of the diagnostic bytes.
  • When logging of data blocks, the diagnostic byte should be logged in hexadecimal values.

ResponseParam.Description:
Data Block ID of Test Facility:

  • The data block ID identifies the sender of data blocks
  • The data block identifier is a presetbackground element in the parameter entry form and is project specific.
  • It must be agreed for each individual project between DSA and the stand manufacturer. Project specific data block identifications prevent that the use of incorrect parameterisation set results in incorrectly control components in the test stand.

Function Result:

Test stand acknowledges the service request by the MFT with

  • 0: no service in progress or ACK of service request 0
  • 1 OK: service correctly completed
  • -1 NOK: service completed with error or service is (temporarily) not available or service is unknown
  • 2 WAIT: service in progress

• Bit1 : Error dienstanforderung (1 bytes)
  • Bit3 : For the parameter error
  • Bit4 : Sammelfehler accessories
  • Bit5 : Sammelfehler does not satisfy

Bit 0: Emergency stop(evaluted by MFT)
Bit 1: Error
Bit 4: Control Mode Automatic, i.e. control by MFT
Bit 5: Control Mode Manual
Bit 6: Control Mode Calibrate
Bit 7: Ready for test(Ready for test of stand doesn't mean BasicState!)
Winkel der Lenkradwaage

Bit 2: Front Axle, 0:no, 1:yes
Bit 3: Front Axle Result, 0:NOK, 1:OK
Bit 4: Rear Axle, 0:no, 1:yes
Bit 5: Rear Axle Result, 0:NOK, 1:OK

Bit 6: Front Axle in Stand
Bit 7: Rear Axle in Stand
Bit 7: Base Position

Response Toggelbyte:

  • Used to determine the response times of the MFT.
  • The MFT writes the value, that is read from the previous response telegram(byte 11), in this request parameter  
  • The test stand increments this value in its response telegram(Byte 11) as soon as Echo of this Toggle byte(service request byte 3) is read from MFT.

Weight Measure RT Single Evaluation:

0: Measured values invalid, measurement not finished yet (will be set, as long as the alignment is not finished and no complete results are available)
1: OK Measured value valid, settings OK
2: NOK Measured value valid, settings NOK
14:System error Test Stand (values invalid)
15:Abort of alignment (measured values valid)

  • 0 : NONE
  • 1 : Result OK
  • 2 : Result NOK

Gesamtbewertung Gewichtsmessung Messwerte ungültig, Messung noch nicht beendet (wird gesetzt, solange die Einstellung noch nicht beendet ist und somit keine vollständigen Resultate vorliegen) OK Messwert gültig, Einstellung OK NOK Messwert ungültig, Einstellung NOK Systemfehler Prüfstand (Messwerte ungültig) @ oder Abbruch der Einstellung - Messwerte ungültig

For Service 9 - Result Weight

  • 0 : NONE
  • 1 : Result OK
  • 2 : Result NOK
  • 14 : SystemError Test Stand

Time information

  • A new time stamp has to be registered for each telegram that is sent to the MFT(optionally a counter can be incremented).
  • The MFT process only the data blocks, of which the time information differ from the last processed data block.

Test stand identification


Each stand within a car plant has a unique Identification Number. This number will be logged in Test Protocol by MFT.
Reserve Reserve-Byte, um gerade Gesamtlänge zu erreichen

Request continuous MFT Number (used for all Service Response):

  • The continuous MFT number is set by the MFT in the request block (byte 41).
  • The test stand mirrors the number in its answer block (byte 41).
  • As soon as the MFT recognizes that the test stand has mirrored this value is its response, the value is increased by 1 in MFT.

The continuous MFT number works analog to the toggle byte in the other direction.

Checksum XOR (used for all Service Response):

  • The checksum is calculted by the MFT using binary XOR for the request bytes 0-31(inclusive).
  • The test stand checks the received telegram and rejects the entire request, if the checksum is not correct.
  • As the response of a request with incorrect checksum repeats the test stand with the last transmitted service response, whereby response counter is updated(and possibly with updated measurement values​​).

Diagnose-Bytes (used for all Service Response):

  • The diagnostic byte is set to 0 by MFT.
  • All Protocol and hardware layers, that involved in the data transfer, can write their diagnostic information in this parameter.
  • The test stand must not assume the contents of the diagnostic bytes.
  • When logging of data blocks, the diagnostic byte should be logged in hexadecimal values.
